results.title: Cinema of vengeance
results.creator_credit: George Tan, Vengeance Productions and Robyn Russell
results.brief_description: A documentary on the history of Martial Arts in film, covering fifty years of Chinese action cinema from the late forties through to present day hi-tech action drama. “Cinema of Vengeance” features profiles of Jackie Chan, Jimmy Wang Yu, Bruce Li, Chow Yun-Fat, Gary Daniels, Samo Hung, Ti Lung, John Woo, Cynthia Rothrock, Don Wilson, Steve James, Mike Kelly and Joe Lewis. It also includes previously unseen footage and an exclusive interview with Bruce Lee.

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Afghanistan, “Switzerland of Asia”, has about twelve million inhabitants and twelve cinemas. To one of these cinemas, the admission is one afghani. (Accorded the Award of Merit, Oberhausen).

results.title: Cinderella: a lesson in compromise
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This “moral tale” discusses the concept of greed and how things should be distributed equally. Two children fight over the proceeds of a product they made and need their uncle to teach them how to fairly share the profit. The uncle uses an excerpt from a Disney cartoon (Lucifer the cat and Cinderella story) in order to convey his message across. Cast includes Philip Abbott, Ruth Lind and Dylan Paiz.

results.title: Cinderella Carrot
results.brief_description: If Russell Crowe was played by a carrot in Cinderella Man you’d have Cinderella Carrot, a triumphant story of carrot vs hamburger. Jim Stalk, a retired boxer from Jersey returns to his home town to save his family from poverty by going up against the mighty Deadly Dan, a hamburger with a body count in the boxing ring.

results.title: Cinderella = La Cenerentola
results.creator_credit: Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen, RM Arts, Michael Hampe and Claus Viller
results.brief_description: Rossini’s version of the Cinderella story stars the bel canto specialists, Ann Murray (Angelina) and Francisco Araiza (the Prince) in this recording of Michael Hampe’s production from the Salzburg Festival.

results.title: Cinderella = La Cenerentola
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Glyndebourne Productions, John Vernon and John Cox
results.brief_description: Gioachino Rossini’s opera in two acts with libretto by Jacopo Ferretti, critical edition by Alberto Zeddo. Rossini’s version of Cinderella was first performed in Rome in 1817. However there is a twist to the original fairy tale - Ferretti’s libretto maintains the human relationships but without the magic of the pantomime fairy tale, and the “lost slipper” becomes a bracelet given by Cinderella to the Prince. The costumes, stage-setting and design are dominated by tones of sepia and gold, like an old-fashioned story book. The leading role of Cenerentola is sung by Kathleen Kuhlmann, with support performances by Marta Taddei (Clarinda) and Laura Zannini (Tisbe) as the two step-sisters, Claudio Desderi as their father Don Magnifico, Laurence Dale as Prince Ramino, Alberto Rinaldi as the valet and Roderick Kennedy as Alidoro. Features the London Philharmonic Orchestra lead by David Nolan, conducted by Donato Renzetti and the Glyndebourne Chorus directed by Jane Glover. This stage production was produced for television as part of the Glyndebourne Festival Opera series. Sung in Italian with English intertitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC-TV, Glyndebourne Productions, John Vernon and John Cox

results.title: Cinderella (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney, Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: Walt Disney’s animated version of Charles Perrault’s classic fairy story. Featuring beautiful colour animation and a lovely musical score this version of “Cinderella” is one of the Disney studios most charming and most loved cartoon features.

results.title: Cinder in your eye
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: An atmospheric and poetic treatment of the restoration of railway engines accompanied by the natural sounds and music of the banjo and harmonica. Locomotives and historic rolling stock once again reign in Tasmania’s superb countryside in this journey into nostalgia.

results.title: Cinco anos [interactive]
results.brief_description: Interactive online work about Barcelona, containing a montage of multi-layered colourful images using hand-drawn animation, newspaper cuttings and stills to convey a sense of the local community and the use of street art.
